input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: GOVERNING BOARD OF THE ALMERIA CITY COUNCIL. Summary: Contract for the Public Street and Beach Cleaning Service in the Municipality of Almeria. Description: The object of this contract is the public street and beach cleaning service in the municipality of Almeria.<br> This service includes cleaning waste abandoned in public spaces including beaches, cleaning stains, graffiti, emptying, washing and maintenance. of litter bins, removal of unwanted weeds and bushes, as well as transporting the collected waste to specific treatment facilities.<br> Law 7/1985, of April 2, on the Bases of the Local Regime, in its article 25.1, attributes to the municipalities the promotion of all kinds of activities and provision of any public services that contribute to satisfying the needs and aspirations of the neighborhood community, pointing out, among others, in article 26, the powers regarding environmental protection and street cleaning.<br> The characteristics of the benefits object of the contract are as follows:<br> • Sweeping of public roads.<br> • Washing of public roads.<br> • Scrubbing public roads.<br> • Cleaning of open and closed tree pits and planters.<br> • Cleaning of leisure and recreation areas.<br> • Cleaning of graffiti and removal of posters.<br> • Cleaning of excrement animals.<br> • Scheduled spot cleaning.<br> • Intensive cleaning of pavements.<br> • Cleaning during leaf, flower and fruit fall season.<br> • Cleaning of municipal lots, boulevards and ravines<br> • Cleaning of industrial areas.<br> • Cleaning of events or f.... Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-12-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: GOVERNING BOARD OF THE ALMERIA CITY COUNCIL
output.Summary: Contract for the Public Street and Beach Cleaning Service in the Municipality of Almeria

input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: FUNDACIÓN MIGUEL SERVET. Summary: Pre-Commercial Procurement (Pcp) of Innovative and Sustainable Solutions to Treat Hospital and Healthcare System Wastewater - Theresa Pcp. Description: In preparation for the THERESA PCP, an Open Market Consultation (OMC) will be held between 22 December 2025 and 28 February 2026, aimed at engaging potential suppliers, research institutions and other stakeholders to inform and refine the procurement strategy and related functional and technical specifications. Activities foreseen include: Launch of the OMC (22 December 2025) with public announcement and registration; in January 2026, local and online events are planned in Spain, the Netherlands, Belgium, Estonia and Poland to present the project scope, requirements and PCP procedure; company pitch sessions; an online Request for Information (RFI) via EU Survey; a Q&A mechanism and matchmaking tool to support networking; bilateral meetings with suppliers; and a final event (26 February 2026) presenting results and next steps. All documents will be available in English. Any changes or updates to the OMC schedule, content, or documentation will be announced and published in a timely manner on the THERESA PCP project website: (www.theresa-pcp.eu/omc). <br> Doc Title: Pre-Commercial Procurement (PCP) of innovative and sustainable solutions to treat Hospital and Healthcare System Wastewater - THERESA PCP <br> Contract Type: services. Tender Value: 2787925. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-12-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: FUNDACIÓN MIGUEL SERVET
output.Summary: Pre-Commercial Procurement (Pcp) of Innovative and Sustainable Solutions to Treat Hospital and Healthcare System Wastewater - Theresa Pcp
output.Description: In preparation for the THERESA PCP, an Open Market Consultation (OMC) will be held between 22 December 2025 and 28 February 2026, aimed at engaging potential suppliers, research institutions and other stakeholders to inform and refine the procurement strategy and related functional and technical specifications. Activities foreseen include: Launch of the OMC (22 December 2025) with public announcement and registration; in January 2026, local and online events are planned in Spain, the Netherlands, Belgium, Estonia and Poland to present the project scope, requirements and PCP procedure; company pitch sessions; an online Request for Information (RFI) via EU Survey; a Q&A mechanism and matchmaking tool to support networking; bilateral meetings with suppliers; and a final event (26 February 2026) presenting results and next steps. All documents will be available in English. Any changes or updates to the OMC schedule, content, or documentation will be announced and published in a timely manner on the THERESA PCP project website: (www.theresa-pcp.eu/omc). <br> Doc Title: Pre-Commercial Procurement (PCP) of innovative and sustainable solutions to treat Hospital and Healthcare System Wastewater - THERESA PCP <br> Contract Type: services

Summary: Pre-Commercial Procurement of an Innovative Systemic Sustainability Transition Solution for Health Care Organisations (Suhco). Description: Procurement will take the form of pre-commercial procurement (PCP), where R&D service contracts will be awarded in parallel to different R&D providers in a phased approach. This will allow alternative, competing solutions to be compared. Each selected operator will receive a framework contract covering three R&D phases. The three phases are: Solution design, prototype development, original development and validation and testing of a limited volume of the first products or services. After each phase, interim evaluations are conducted to select the best of the competing solutions. The contractors with the best value for money will be offered a specific contract for the next phase. The selected operators will retain ownership of the intellectual property rights (IPRs) they generate during the PCP and will be able to use them to exploit the full market potential of the solutions developed. All interested operators are invited to take part in the upcoming open market consultation (regardless of their geographic location , the size or governance structure of their organisation). The open market consultation will be organised in the form of a series of meetings. It will provide you with an overview of the procurement objectives, the PCP process and the main clauses of the contract. You will also have the opportunity to ask questions. In accordance with the provision contained in article 99.3.b) of the current Law 9/2017, of November 8, on Contracts of the Public Sector (LCSP), the object of the contract does not allow its fractionation into lots, given the integral nature of the nature of its object and the unavoidable need to coordinate the different services to be performed. input: Country: Spain. Purchaser Name: DEPUTY OF GIRONA. Summary: 2025/9780 Service for the Diagnosis and Management Proposal of Public Use in the Rocacorba Mountains and Serra De Finestres Natural Area of ​​Interest. Description: Description of the service: The object of the contract is to obtain the service for the diagnosis and management proposal of the public use in the Muntanyes de Rocacorba and Serra de Finestres Natural Area of ​​Interest, in accordance with the requirements and conditions detailed in the technical specifications document. The main tasks to be carried out are: • Diagnosis of the current situation: collection of cartographic information, itineraries, attendance data (APPS, surveys, observations in the field) and mobility guidelines (with and without vehicle).•Identification of impacts on the environment and activities by type (motorized vehicles, bicycles, hiking, etc.).•Citizen participation, including interest groups, in three phases: diagnosis (phase I), return (phase II) and proposals (phase III).• Technical coordination meetings with Provincial Council, Generalitat and town councils.• Development of management proposals and actions for 3-5 years, with calendar and possible sources of financing.• Drafting of municipal ordinances as a document attached to the Plan of management.•Preparation of final documentation (reports, cartography in shape format, presentation PPT and proposals for scheduled and budgeted actions).. Tender Value: 22185.16. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-18. Closing Date: 2025-11-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: DEPUTY OF GIRONA

The main tasks to be carried out are: • Diagnosis of the current situation: collection of cartographic information, itineraries, attendance data (APPS, surveys, observations in the field) and mobility guidelines (with and without vehicle).•Identification of impacts on the environment and activities by type (motorized vehicles, bicycles, hiking, etc.).•Citizen participation, including interest groups, in three phases: diagnosis (phase I), return (phase II) and proposals (phase III).• Technical coordination meetings with Provincial Council, Generalitat and town councils.• Development of management proposals and actions for 3-5 years, with calendar and possible sources of financing.• Drafting of municipal ordinances as a document attached to the Plan of management.•Preparation of final documentation (reports, cartography in shape format, presentation PPT and proposals for scheduled and budgeted actions).
